page.title: 04POPULATION IN CHERINGTON
page.content: This survey was concerned with the longevity and population movement of 54 children aged between 5 and 11 in the Minchinhampton, Cherington and Avening areas. 60% were born in Gloucestershire. 30 children had both grandfathers still alive, 17 had 1 and 7 neither. 37 had both grandmothers living, 15 had 1 and 2 neither. 8 had 1 great-grandfather surviving, 1 had 2 but no-one had more. 10 children had one great-grandmother alive, 4 had 2 and l had 3. 16 children said both parents were born in Gloucestershire, 20 said one was and 18 neither. 20 children said that none of their grandparents was born in the county, 14 said 1 was, 14 said 2, 3 said 3 and 3 said all 4 were native to Gloucestershire, an interesting contrast to evidence from Victorian Censuses.
